resources.string: By Selecting one or the other, you are agreeing to let us use the internet for calculation purposes, JazakAllah
Network connection too slow or unavailable.
Salah Tawqit needs to know your location for accurate prayer timings.
Or you can select a location manually.
Location isn\'t enabled, please enable GPS, or use manual calculation mode
Error Finding Location\nPlease Try Again\nOr Use Manual Calculation.
Sleeping Sun, describes how sleepy we are when it\'s fajr time.
Crying sun with a thermometer, describes the usual warmth at the time of dhuhr.
A rising sun with a smile, describes the sweet tenderness of the morning.
A smiling and shining sun, describes the usual mild temperature at the time of Asr.
The sun is setting off and dozing, normal sunset behaviour.
The sun is gone and the moon is nowhere, we are left in darkness. It\'s maghrib time.
The moon has shown up and it\'s happy, quite the time for Isha.
It\'s midnight and its so dark even the moon is asleep, indeed you should pray Tahajjud.
The best of the day, indeed, is the mild sunlight and chirping birds of Ishraq.
Flowers bloom and birds chirp in the sharp yet lovely sunlight while you pray Duha.
Just as the sun settles and the moon starts to rise, pray awwabin.
Can be prayed anytime after isha and before fajr but, the best time to pray is after 6/7th of the night and before fajr.
Can be prayed 10–20 minutes after sunrise, although 20 minutes are preferred to stay safe from post-sunrise makruh time.
Can be prayed right next to ishraq until dhuhr but, it\'s preferred to pray when the sun has risen quite high above the sky.
Can be prayed right next to maghrib but it\'s preferred to complete maghrib and pray awwabin anytime before isha starts.
Invalid city name, Please enter an actual city\'s name.
Error finding timezone for this city, please try again or use automatic calculation.
